step1.sentence: After the project failed, she was the only one who took ownership of the mistakes and proposed a plan to fix them.

step2.story: The new manager noticed that everyone on the team kept blaming each other when deadlines were missed. During the next meeting, she stood up and said, "From now on, I'm going to take ownership of every deliverable — and I expect each of you to do the same." Within a month, the team's performance had completely turned around.

step3.story: Jinho had been at the company for three years, but he always let his senior colleagues handle the difficult decisions. One day, a critical bug brought down the entire payment system during peak hours. His team lead was on vacation, and no one else stepped forward. Jinho took a deep breath and decided to take ownership of the situation. He coordinated with the engineering team, communicated updates to the stakeholders, and guided the fix through to deployment. When his team lead returned, she told him that taking ownership like that was exactly what separated a good engineer from a great one.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 직역하면 '소유권을 가지다'라는 뜻으로, 어떤 것의 주인이 되는 것을 의미합니다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 실제로는 어떤 일이나 문제에 대해 스스로 책임을 지고 주도적으로 해결하겠다는 태도를 나타낼 때 씁니다. 단순히 맡는다는 뜻을 넘어, 결과까지 끝까지 책임지겠다는 강한 의지를 포함합니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: ownership(소유권)은 own(소유하다)에서 파생된 단어로, 원래는 재산의 소유를 뜻했습니다. 이것이 비즈니스 맥락에서 '책임의 소유'로 확장되어, 업무나 문제에 대한 주인의식을 표현하는 데 쓰이게 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 비즈니스와 리더십 맥락에서 매우 긍정적인 뉘앙스를 가집니다. 이 표현을 쓰면 수동적으로 시킨 일만 하는 것이 아니라, 능동적이고 프로페셔널한 태도를 보여준다는 인상을 줍니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: If you want to grow in your career, you need to take ownership of your projects.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 커리어에서 성장하고 싶다면, 자신의 프로젝트에 책임감을 가져야 합니다.
